ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:21): +Hi. I've been trying for some time now to figure out what is creating a white/blueish border line between the table cells. If anyone can tell me how to get ride of it it would be much appreciated. http://www.venmarces.com/example.html. Yes I know it does not validate, this is because Firefox removed the valid code when I did a save page as to create an example.

77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:24): +TheWarden: border-bottom: 1px solid #3366CC;

(the site logo is just an inline <a>)
9120874bdd7b85ba45d69d7728790069 (02:28): +does anyone know what is more correct to use
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:28): +age6racer: yes I tried all of them...

ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:30): +riczho: if you look at the page now, that is how it looks the that border removed, still a space there between the td cells
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:30): +`css table-collapse
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:30): +riczho: also that is reffering to the border of the bottom now the spacing between the TD cells.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:31): +*gasp* I've forgotten!
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:31): +`css border-collapse
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (02:31): +css border-collapse: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/tables.html#propdef-border-collapse
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:32): +it's either a border style some place I'm not seeing or a padding/margin style I'm not seeing..

ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:33): +riczho: correct me here if I'm wrong but border-collapse and border-spacing is not presently supported be IE. However this problem happens in Firefox and IE.

ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:34): +age6racer: http://www.venmarces.com/example_files/default.css
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:35): +is there a way to use margin: 0 auto; with a auto-width div?
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:36): +so have the div be dynamically sized based on what is inside, but also dynamically centered?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:36): +TheWarden: Wow..  can't believe I missed this.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:36): +Set border-collapse: collapse on table.default.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:36): +And note that .default table {} in the CSS selects nothing.
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:37): +riczho: I have done that before and it did nothing. I did it now, take a look. So are you saying I should have table.default ?
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:38): +So really I should always have element.class at all times instead of the other way around?
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:40): +riczho: after fixing that to table.default it seem to correct it. I wonder why I did that... I normally do it that way. Anyways thanks.
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:40): +riczho: should I be changing this .default td, .default th to td.default, th.default ?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:41): +No.. it's <table class="default">
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:41): +So that stuff is correct.
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:42): +anyone?
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:42): +can I have a auto-width div that is centered via auto left/right margins?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:43): +MrPunkin: "auto width" div is 100% (divs are block)
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:43): +riczho: so I can't collapse a div to its content?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:43): +Use a span and text-align: center; on the container?
ea05b9d68a3182bed609fdf0c15c4996 (02:43): +riczho: ok thanks.
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:44): +roczho: this is a content div that will expand to be the width of whatever image is inside of it
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:44): +but have divs within it that will be set to 100% to always be the width of that image thats inside the div
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:44): +maybe it's not possible?
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:47): +is there a way to collapse a div's width to only that of it's largest child?
aad67ac8ac9be0c0a4d9b55a7c1739e0 (02:47): +and not be a whole 100% of the browser window
